passages.title: The Water Cycle
passages.content: The water cycle is a continuous process by which water circulates between the Earth's oceans, atmosphere, and land. It involves the following key stages: evaporation, condensation, precipitation, and collection. First, the sun heats water in rivers, lakes, and oceans, causing evaporation. The water vapor rises into the atmosphere where it cools and condenses into clouds. When the clouds become heavy with water droplets, precipitation occurs in the form of rain, snow, sleet, or hail. The water then collects in bodies of water or soaks into the ground, and the cycle begins again. This process is essential for sustaining life on Earth and regulating the planet's climate.

passages.title: Should Students Wear School Uniforms?
passages.content: The debate over school uniforms has been ongoing for decades. Supporters argue that uniforms promote equality among students by eliminating visible economic disparities and reducing peer pressure related to clothing choices. They also claim that uniforms improve discipline and academic performance by creating a more serious learning environment. However, opponents contend that uniforms suppress individual expression and creativity, which are important aspects of personal development. They argue that the cost of uniforms can be burdensome for low-income families, and there is limited evidence that uniforms actually improve academic outcomes. Both sides present valid points, making this a complex issue without a simple solution.

passages.title: The Lost Wallet
passages.content: Sarah rushed down the crowded street, her heart pounding with anxiety. She had just realized that her wallet was missing. It contained not just her money and credit cards, but also her mother's antique locket—the only memento she had from her grandmother. Retracing her steps, Sarah returned to the coffee shop where she had been earlier. The young barista looked up as Sarah approached the counter. "Excuse me," Sarah said breathlessly, "I think I left my wallet here." The barista smiled warmly and reached under the counter. "Is this yours?" she asked, holding up a familiar brown leather wallet. Relief washed over Sarah as she checked inside—everything was there, including the precious locket. "Thank you so much," Sarah said gratefully. "You've saved me from a terrible day." The barista simply nodded and said, "I'm just glad I could help. Someone did the same for me once."

passages.title: Community Library Event
passages.content:
NOTICE: Summer Reading Program

The Riverside Community Library is pleased to announce our annual Summer Reading Program for all ages!

Dates: June 1 - August 31

Program Highlights:
• Children (ages 5-12): Read 10 books to earn prizes
• Teens (ages 13-18): Participate in book clubs and creative writing workshops
• Adults: Join our monthly book discussion groups

Special Events:
• June 15: Author Meet-and-Greet with bestselling novelist Maria Chen
• July 20: Family Movie Night featuring classic adaptations
• August 10: Book Sale (all proceeds benefit library programs)

Registration: Sign up at the main desk or online at www.riversidelibrary.org

For more information, contact: library@riverside.org or call (555) 123-4567

Note: All events are free for library members. Non-members can purchase a day pass for $5.

items.stem: What does 'happy' mean?

What does 'suggest' mean in this sentence?
What is the opposite meaning of 'benefit'?
What does 'diverse' mean?

The athlete's performance has been consistent throughout the season, always scoring between 15 and 20 points.

What does 'consistent' mean in this sentence?
Which word means the same as 'subtle'?

The professor's explanation was coherent and easy to follow, with all the ideas connected logically.

What does 'coherent' mean?
What does 'ubiquitous' mean?
What is the opposite meaning of 'meticulous' (showing great attention to detail)?

The beauty of cherry blossoms is ephemeral, lasting only a few days before the petals fall.

What does 'ephemeral' mean?
Which word means the same as 'corroborate' (to confirm or support)?
What does 'obfuscate' mean?

options.B: To make something confusing or unclear

items.stem:
The recalcitrant student refused to follow any of the teacher's instructions, despite repeated warnings.

The company decided to flumbinate their marketing strategy to reach more customers.

What does 'flumbinate' mean?

What does 'grelastic' mean?

options.A: The sun is the most important part of the water cycle
options.B: The water cycle is a continuous process that sustains life
options.C: Rain is the only form of precipitation
options.D: Water only exists in oceans and rivers

items.stem: According to the passage, what happens AFTER water vapor condenses into clouds?
Based on the passage, why is the water cycle important?

options.B: It sustains life and regulates climate

items.stem: What is the author's main purpose in this passage?

options.A: To convince readers that uniforms are necessary
options.B: To present both sides of the school uniform debate
options.C: To prove that uniforms harm students
options.D: To describe what school uniforms look like

items.stem: Which statement best evaluates the strength of the arguments presented?

options.A: Only the supporters' arguments are valid
options.B: Both sides present valid points, making it complex
options.D: Neither side has any valid arguments
